Posting a full review to help other travelers. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Daniels place. The house had all of the amenities we needed. Daniel was prompt with communication, helpful & provided a guide for places to eat & visit.
The home was spacious, well decorated and had a great backyard space that we used for grilling. We also enjoyed watching movies with the surround sound & apple TV.
A few things to note: Having never been to Morehead City before, I didn't realize that the main road through town was actually HWY 70, a 4 lane highway with a train track running through the middle. Pulling out of the driveway with the traffic was quite a challenge.
If you are looking for a quiet stay, this isn't the spot, as traffic sounds & the train often rattled the windows.
However, if you are looking for affordable, cozy cottage close to the water - book this house! The house is centrally located. Its less than 15 minutes from most everything. My son loved Ft. Macon & the NC aquarium.
Also, not any fault of Daniel's, but something to note for those booking in the coming weeks (August 2022). There was construction happening on the neighboring house resulting in loud noises throughout the day.
This property also has a shared drive way, which is normally no issue, however the construction and piles of debris & trash from the neighbor were less than desirable.
The neighbor to the left was an older gentlemen & very friendly. He welcomed us, offered us great tips and places to visit.
Overall, after our stay, even with the noise, I would come back to Daniels place if we are ever in Morehead City. The home is well kept, centrally located, and a great alternative to hotels!
Thank you Daniel for being a great host, and allowing us to stay in this cozy cottage.
